tp:docstring.p: A "tube" is a mechanism for arbitrary data transfer. Currently, one kind of data transfer is specified, namely that of D-Bus messages. Each tube has a service name, which is a string specifying the kind of communication that takes place over it, and a dictionary of arbitrary parameters. Tube parameters are commonly used for bootstrap information such as usernames and passwords. Each tube is identified by a locally unique identifier.
The Tubes channel type may be requested for handles of type HANDLE_TYPE_CONTACT and HANDLE_TYPE_ROOM.
An ordered reliable transport, for transporting D-Bus traffic.

For each D-Bus tube, the connection manager listens on a D-Bus server address, as detailed in the D-Bus specification. On this address, it emulates a bus upon which each tube participant appears as an endpoint.

The objects and interfaces which are expected to exist on the emulated bus depend on the well-known name; typically, either the participant who initiated the tube is expected to export the same objects/interfaces that would be exported by a service of that name on a bus, or all participants are expected to export those objects/interfaces.
An ordered reliable transport, for transporting TCP traffic through a Unix stream socket.

For each Stream Unix tube offered, the connection manager exports a local Unix socket to the participants of the tube. When accepting a Stream Unix tube, a new listening local socket is created. Each time the client connects to this socket, the connection manager of the initiator of the tube opens a new connection to its local socket. Both sides can then use this pair of sockets to communicate together.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The tube is waiting to be accepted/closed locally.
The tube is waiting to be accepted/closed remotely.
The tube is open for traffic.

arg.tp:docstring: An array of the available tube types, as defined by the Tube_Type enum.

Return an array of tuples, each representing a tube, with the following members:
the tube's ID
the tube's initiator
the tube's type
the tube's service
the tube's parameters
the tube's state

method.name: OfferTube
method.tp:docstring: Offers a tube providing the service specified, over a tube of the specified type.

arg.name: type
arg.tp:docstring: The type of tube wanted, one of the values from the Tube_Type enum.

arg.name: service
arg.tp:docstring: A string representing the service that will be used over the tube.

arg.name: parameters
arg.tp:docstring: A dicionary of properties for the new tube.
The ID of the new tube.

method.name: OfferDBusTube
method.tp:docstring: Offers a D-Bus tube providing the service specified.

arg.name: service
arg.tp:docstring: A string representing the service name that will be used over the tube. It should be a well-known D-Bus service name, of the form com.example.ServiceName.

arg.name: parameters
arg.tp:docstring: A dictionary of properties for the new tube.
The ID of the new tube.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: The contact associated with this channel doesn't have tubes capabilities.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotImplemented
tp:error.tp:docstring: The connection manager doesn't support D-Bus tubes.

method.name: OfferStreamUnixTube
method.tp:docstring: Offers a Stream Unix tube exporting the local socket specified.

arg.name: service
arg.tp:docstring:
A string representing the service name that will be used over the tube. It should be a well-known TCP service name as defined by
http://www.dns-sd.org/ServiceTypes.html.

arg.name: socket
arg.tp:docstring: The path of the local Unix socket exported over the tube.

arg.name: parameters
arg.tp:docstring: A dictionary of properties for the new tube.
The ID of the new tube.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: The contact associated with this channel doesn't have tubes capabilities.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotImplemented
tp:error.tp:docstring: The connection manager doesn't support Stream Unix tubes.

signal.name: NewTube
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when a tube is created.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the new tube.

arg.name: initiator
arg.tp:docstring: The handle of the contact who initiated the tube.

arg.name: type
arg.tp:docstring: The tube type, as defined by the Tube_Type enum.

arg.name: service
arg.tp:docstring: A string representing the service that will be used over the tube.

arg.name: parameters
arg.tp:docstring: The new tube's properties.

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: The new tube's state.

method.name: AcceptTube
method.tp:docstring: Accept a tube that's in the "local pending" state. The connection manager will attempt to open the tube. The tube remains in the "local pending" state until the TubeStateChanged signal is emitted.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube to accept.

signal.name: TubeStateChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when the state of a tube changes.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube that changed state.

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: The new state of the tube; see the Tube_State enumeration.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube to close.

signal.name: TubeClosed
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when a tube has been closed. The ID of a closed tube is no longer valid. The ID may later be reused for a new tube.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube that was closed.

method.name: GetDBusServerAddress
method.tp:docstring: For a D-Bus tube, return a string describing the address of the private bus.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube to get an address for.
The bus address.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.InvalidArgument
tp:error.tp:docstring: The tube is not a D-Bus tube.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: This tube is not in the "open" state.

method.name: GetDBusNames
method.tp:docstring: For a D-Bus tube, obtain a mapping between contact handles and their unique bus names on this tube.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube to get names for.
An array of structures, each containing a contact handle and a D-Bus bus name.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.InvalidArgument
tp:error.tp:docstring: The tube is not a D-Bus tube.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: This tube is not in the "open" state.

signal.name: DBusNamesChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted on a D-Bus tube when a participant opens or closes the tube.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube whose names have changed.

arg.name: added
arg.tp:docstring: Array of handles and D-Bus names of new participants.

arg.name: removed
arg.tp:docstring: Array of handles of former participants.

method.name: GetStreamUnixSocketAddress
method.tp:docstring: For a Stream Unix tube, obtain the path of the Unix socket used to communicate over this tube.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube to get the socket for.
A string containing the path of the Unix socket.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.InvalidArgument
tp:error.tp:docstring: The tube is not a Stream Unix tube.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: This tube is not in the "open" state.

signal.name: StreamUnixSocketNewConnection
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted on a Stream Unix tube when a participant opens a new connection to its socket.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the tube

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: The handle of the participant who opened the new connection
